Hey! you know what, this morning my car broke
down and I had to take a lift from my friend.

Well, but he drives so slowly that it took
forever for me to get to the workplace.

Welcome Everyone I am Niharika and in today's
lesson we are gonna learn how to form adverbs.

Now probably most of us know how to form adverbs
but many at times when we try to write adverbs

we make spelling errors. So in this lesson
we are going to look at some tips for us to

form adverbs and also to form them correctly.
SO lets get started. This first thing that

you need to know is the meaning of an adverb.
So what exactly are adverbs? Well adverbs

describe verbs. SO basically adverbs describe
actions. For example I eat slowly, my dog

runs quickly. Okay, so slowly, quickly are
describing the action. So, therefore slowly

and quickly are your adverbs. Also, we need
to understand that, adverbs are formed from

adjectives. Okay, so you need to keep in mind
that always the adverbs are formed from adjectives.

So now lets have a look at some rules that
would help you to form adverbs. SO let's get

started.
Now the very first basic rule is that you

need to add the letters 'ly' to an adjective
and there you get your adverb. So lets look

at some examples here. Now all these words
that are listed are adjectives. Now how do

we form the adverbs out of these adjectives,
well let's learn. So we have the word quick

so very simple you need to add the letter
'ly' to the word quick. So quickly is your

adverbs, that's simple right!
Lets have a look at another adjective which

is sudden, For sudden, the adverb will be
suddenly. Another adjective that I have for

you is nice. So here that's your adverb , we
add the letter 'ly' to the end of an adjective.

Another one politely. And then we have words
like special and we have true , due and full.

Now here just make a note, whenever adjectives
or the words that end with the letter 'l'

or with letter 'e' we of course end up adding
the letter 'ly' to form an adverb, but there

are few exceptions. SO the exceptions are
like for example the adjective true. Well,

if you look at the spelling its true, it ends
with the letter e however 
the adverb spelling is truly. So you need

to delete the letter 'e'
These are just few exceptions. However most

of the words that end with 'e', you don't
have to delete the letter 'e' but just add

the letters 'ly' for your adverbs. SO these
are exceptions like the word true, so truly

is the adverb for you however we do not have
the letter 'e' in it. Another one due, the

adverb will be duly and for the word full
your adverb will be fully. So these are just

couple of exceptions that we have and now
lets have a look at another rule.

So here are some more rules that you need
to keep in mind in order to form adverbs.

So lets have a look here - Now the adjectives
ending with the letter 'y' - how do you form

the adverb? Well, you need to get rid of the
'y' and you need to add 'ily'. Okay, so that's

simple. we have some examples here like the
word crazy.So here your adverb will be crazily.

She partied crazily. So crazily will be your
adverb, so you are getting rid of the 'y'

and you are adding ' ily'
Another example happily. She danced happily.

So it's gonna be ...again we say goodbye to
the letter 'y' and we add 'ily'. Another one

is lazy. I spent my Sunday lazily. Here your
adverb is lazily, where in you get rid of

the letter y and you add 'ily'. And the last
example here is hungry so your formed adverb

will be spelt hungrily. Hope this is clear
to you and now lets move on to another rule.

Adjective ending with 'le',so how do we form
adverbs with the adjectives that end with

the letters 'le'? very simple, you need to
replace the letter e with the letter y. Simple?

Let's have a look at the examples here. Terrible
- She cooked terribly. So terribly is your

adverb but you get rid of the 'e' basically
you replace the 'e' with the letter 'y', that's

gonna be terribly. Another one, comfortable.
Well that's your adjective, how do you form

the adverb again get rid of the e and place
the letter y so it is comfortably.

Another one - possible - replace the 'e' with
the letter 'y' so it's gonna be possibly.

And then, incredible - again replace the 'e'
with the letter 'y' so you have your adverb
which is incredibly.

And now let's have a look at the last rule
which is adjectives ending with 'ic'. There

are adjectives that end with letters 'ic'
and what do you do in order to form adverbs?

So you need to add the letter ' ally' very
simple you need to add the letters 'ally'.

We will look at the example to understand
this better. We have the word ironic. so here

your adverb would be ironically so therefore
you are gonna add the letter ' ally'. So it's

ironically. Your adverb for the adjective
realistic would be realistically. So add these

letters and it is realistically. And then
another example for you here is enthusiastic

- she spent her weekend enthusiastically.
So enthusiastically is your adverb and how

did you form it? you just added the letter
' ally'

So that's very simple , we have four rules
where in we just simple add the letters ' ly'

to an adverb that's what we learnt and then
we have adjectives that end with letter 'y'

we have to add letters 'ily' by getting rid
of this 'y', adjectives ending with the letter

'le' you gonna replace the 'e' with the letter
'y' and the adjectives ending with 'ic well

very simple you just gonna add the letters
ally to form your adverbs. so hope this is

clear to you. Now its time to take a test,
